backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no logic.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping fullscreen Leaflet fixes to specific frontend files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing multiple frontend source files and their roles.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining OKLCH color tokens and theming variables for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entrypoint loading Leaflet CSS/JS and mounting the React app.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Wraps the app in a theme provider and renders the EarthquakeDashboard.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Dashb: Displays earthquake summary statistics using styled cards and icons.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Earth: Dialog showing full earthquake details with magnitude badges, metadata, and fetched event detail info.
Leaflet-based map with marker rendering, fullscreen handling, and visibility filtering based on bounds.
Renders a virtualized earthquake results table with selectable rows and adaptive height, displaying magnitude, location, and other metadata.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/FeedA: Provides UI controls for time window, minimum magnitude, search text, and manual refresh of earthquake data.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Panel: Reusable panel wrapper component with styled header, optional actions, and content area for consistent layouts.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, invalidating related queries on identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Context and hooks for managing Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and stored identity loading.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file noting that USGS fetching is handled elsewhere.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEarthquakes.ts: React Query hook that fetches USGS earthquake feeds by time window with auto-refresh and manual refresh support.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEventDetail.ts: Fetches and caches detailed USGS event data by URL with optional enabling and retry logic.
frontend/src/hooks/useVirtualWindow.ts: Implements a lightweight virtualization system computing visible item ranges based on scroll position and container size.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind layers, color variables, theming, custom scrollbars, map-related z-index fixes, and utility styles.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeFilters.ts: Provides filtering utilities for earthquakes by time window, magnitude, place, and includes time‑descending sorting.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeMapBounds.ts: Filters earthquakes to those within (or slightly outside) given Leaflet map bounds, handling padded bounds and date‑line wrapping.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeStats.ts: Computes basic stats from earthquake features, including totals, count above magnitude threshold, and the largest quake.
frontend/src/lib/fetchJson.ts: Simple wrapper around fetch that retrieves JSON and throws on HTTP errors.
frontend/src/lib/formatters.ts: Formatting helpers for timestamps, magnitude, depth, and geographic coordinates.
frontend/src/lib/leafletTypes.ts: Type definitions and utilities for Leaflet, including marker creation with magnitude‑based styling.
frontend/src/lib/mmi.ts: Utilities to map MMI values to Roman numerals and labels, with formatting helpers.
frontend/src/lib/usgsEventDetailTypes.ts: Type definitions for USGS event detail responses, including product metadata.
frontend/src/lib/usgsFeeds.ts: Builds USGS feed URLs and provides magnitude labels and color classifications.
frontend/src/lib/usgsTypes.ts: Core TypeScript types for USGS earthquake feed features, responses, and filter configs.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point initializing React, React Query, and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.t: Main dashboard page handling filters, view modes, data fetching, stats, and earthquake detail selection.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining theme extensions, colors, animations, and plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing current state, issues, and existing feature requirements related to Leaflet fullscreen bugs.
